definitions.definition: determine the total number of (a collection of items).
examples: I started to count the stars I could see
synonyms: tot up; Morecensus; formalenumerate; datedcast up "Vern counted the money again"

definitions.definition: recite numbers in ascending order, usually starting at the number one.
examples: hold the position as you count to five

definitions.definition: recite or display numbers backward to zero to indicate the time remaining before the launch of a rocket or the start of an operation.
examples: the floor manager pointed at the camera and counted down

definitions.definition: prepare for a significant event in the short time remaining before it.
examples: with more orders expected, the company is counting down to a bumper Christmas

definitions.definition: take into account; include.
examples: the staff has shrunk to four, or five if you count the summer intern

definitions.definition: include someone in an activity or the plans for it.
examples: if the project gets started, count me in

definitions.definition: consider (someone or something) to possess a specified quality or fulfill a specified role.
examples: she met some rebuffs from people she had counted as her friends
synonyms: account "I count it a privilege to be asked"

definitions.definition: be regarded as possessing a specified quality or fulfilling a specified role.
examples: the rebate counts as taxable income

definitions.definition: be significant.
examples: it did not matter what the audience thoughtâ€”it was the critics that counted
synonyms: carry weight "it's your mother's feelings that count"

definitions.definition: (of a factor) play a part in influencing opinion for or against someone or something.
examples: he hopes his sportsmanlike attitude will count in his favor

definitions.definition: be worth (a specified amount).
examples: he has no power base and his views count for little

definitions.definition: be included in an assessment of (a final result or amount).
examples: reduced rate contributions do not count toward your pension

definitions.definition: rely on.
examples: whatever you're doing, you can count on me
synonyms: take as read "you can count on me"

definitions.definition: an act of determining the total number of something.
examples: at the last count, fifteen applications were still outstanding

definitions.definition: the total determined by counting.
examples: there was a moderate increase in the white cell count in both patients

definitions.definition: an act of reciting numbers in ascending order, up to the specified number.
examples: hold the position for five counts

definitions.definition: an act of reciting numbers up to ten by the referee when a boxer is knocked down, the boxer being considered knocked out if still down when ten is reached.
the number of balls and strikes that have been charged to the batter, as recalculated with each pitch.
examples: the count on Gwynn is 1 ball and 2 strikes

definitions.definition: a point for discussion or consideration.
examples: the program remained vulnerable on a number of counts

definitions.definition: a separate charge in an indictment.
examples: he pleaded guilty to five counts of murder

definitions.definition: the measure of the fineness of a yarn expressed as the weight of a given length or the length of a given weight.
a measure of the fineness of a woven fabric expressed as the number of warp or weft threads in a given length.
a European nobleman whose rank corresponds to that of an English earl.
